meanings.definition: Copygirls: plural noun, women who make copies of documents
meanings.sent1: The copygirls worked diligently in the office, copying important papers.
meanings.sent2: The copygirls at the library helped people duplicate papers efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The copygirls decided to have a race to see who could copy the fastest.
meanings.sent4: She was like a copygirl, replicating documents with precision and speed.
meanings.sent5: The copygirls wore matching uniforms and always had their copying machines ready.

meanings.definition: Copygirls: verb, to imitate or reproduce something
meanings.sent1: She tried to copygirls her friend's dance moves but couldn't quite get it right.
meanings.sent2: The artist wanted to copygirls the style of the famous painter in her own work.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he could copygirls his cat's meow, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to copygirls the accents of different regions was truly impressive.
meanings.sent5: The students were asked to copygirls the experiment exactly as shown in the demonstration.

meanings.definition: Copygirls: adjective, relating to women who make copies of documents
meanings.sent1: The office had a copygirls room where all the copying tasks were done.
meanings.sent2: She wore a copygirls badge that identified her as part of the document duplication team.
meanings.sent3: The copygirls competition was fierce as each participant aimed to be the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Her copygirls skills were unmatched in the entire department.
meanings.sent5: The copygirls department was always buzzing with the sound of copying machines.
